content.description: <math alttext="The figure presents a three row table, with four columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x.” The heading for row 2 is “f of x.” The heading for row 3 is “f prime of x.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. x is 1. f of x is negative 2. f prime of x is 2. Column 2. x is 2. f of x is 1. f prime of x is 4. Column 3. x is 3. f of x is 6. f prime of x is negative 1. Column 4. x is 4. f of x is 3. f prime of x is negative 4." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 3em 3em" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="0.05ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has a continuous second derivative. The table above gives values of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and its derivative, <math alttext="f prime" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, at selected values of <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the value of <math alttext="the integral from, 1 to 2, of x times, f double prime of x, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>x</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.15em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 6.11: (BC ONLY) Integrating Using Integration by Parts

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
